summary: This bill, "Dillon's Law," amends the Public Health Service Act to prioritize states in children's asthma treatment grant programs that allow trained individuals, even those not employed by the school, to administer epinephrine at schools. It also updates the language regarding epinephrine delivery systems and clarifies specific aspects of the act related to school personnel and trained individuals. The bill aims to facilitate better asthma treatment in schools by broadening the scope of individuals who can provide aid.
